result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:54 PM - case called.    Defendant Megan R. Cossabone in court.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court addresses the Defendant regarding appointment from the public defender office.  Court questions the Defendant regarding scheduling the preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives time limits.  Court accepts the waiver of time limits.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Defendant updated her address on the record.
Scheduling conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Relay Sheet / Identification Processing / DNA at Arrest

No contact with the co-defendant, Scott Martin.  Absolute sobriety.  May not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.  Submit to Lincoln County Sheriff's Department for booking if not already completed.

No contact with the co-defendant, Scott Martin.  Absolute sobriety.  May not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.  Submit to Lincoln County Sheriff's Department for booking if not already completed.

1:49 PM - case called.  Defendant Megan R. Cossabone in court.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  In receipt of complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Defendant has contacted the public defender office.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court sets bond.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
